channel.title: OnOptions
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from OnOptions, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: The Gen Z job crisis is real: 1.2 million recent grads in the U.K. competed for just 17,000 open roles
item.description: Rob Breare, CEO of independent U.K. school system Malvern College International, said at Fortune’s Global Forum that AI is upending the job hunt as we...

item.title: How to Build an HR Department Your Employees Won’t Hate
item.description: This Inc. 5000 company founder shares her HR hiring mistakes—and how she pivoted to build her dream team.

item.title: New York’s subway is waging a war on fare evasion with hostile architecture
item.description: In January 2025, subway riders at the 59th Street-Lexington Avenue station in Manhattan noticed a surprising new addition: spiked metal partitions bet...

item.title: Amazon Just Announced 14,000 Layoffs. CEO Andy Jassy Meant It When He Said AI Would Replace Jobs
item.description: The company announced the cuts to its corporate workforce in a blog post.

item.title: How to focus your attention and be free of distractions
item.description: Below, Zelana Montminy shares five key insights from her new book, Finding Focus: Own Your Attention in an Age of Distraction . Zelana is a behavioral...

item.title: Meet the tween whisperers helping Gen Alpha—and their parents—through puberty
item.description: As a mother of two little girls, I expected that puberty would be a tempestuous time for our family, full of emotional roller coasters and bodily chan...

item.title: MS NOW’s new ‘Morning Joe’ newsletter wants to look like a magazine
item.description: Morning Joe host Joe Scarborough is ready to spill the tea in a new newsletter. Called The Tea, Spilled by Morning Joe , the revamped newsletter for t...

item.title: Is having too much money immoral? Research shows it depends on your values and where you live
item.description: Across cultures, people often wrestle with whether having lots of money is a blessing, a burden, or a moral problem. According to our new research, ho...

item.title: Gen Zers are using AI to skip meetings, get promoted faster and win bigger salary hikes. But they don’t feel great about it
item.description: While AI note-taking saves workers hours each week and drives faster promotions, the same young employees worry that their dependence on the tech coul...

item.title: Ray Dalio is guided by gratitude: Why CEOs need to find their codifying principles
item.description: Also: All the news and watercooler chat from Fortune.

item.title: With two new funds to trumpet, Sequoia’s Roelof Botha opens up about the state of the VC market—and about the firm’s controversial partner
item.description: The managing partner of Silicon Valley's storied VC firm had a lot of news to discuss in his appearance at a San Francisco startup conference.

item.title: My New Employee Has Gone AWOL
item.description: … and two other tricky workplace dilemmas.

item.title: Netflix and Amazon Prime are using AI algorithms that hide content from some users, media executive says
item.description: “The larger problem comes in distribution and the use of algo when content is being shown,” Reliance Industries media president Jyoti Deshpande said.

item.title: La Niña Is Here—What Does it Mean for Winter Weather?
item.description: La Niña has arrived, fueled by colder-than-normal Pacific Ocean temperatures. Will it bring lots of snow this time?

item.title: 3 Ways to Get Credit for Your Success—Without Sounding Like a Braggart
item.description: Workplace triumphs are rarely the result of completely solo efforts, and you’ll find that a little recognition of others goes a long way to boosting y...
